text: Carnival in White () is a 1952 West German comedy film directed by Hans Albin and Harry R. Sokal, starring Adrian Hoven, Hannelore Bollmann and Lucie Englisch.Bock & Bergfelder p.33 It was made at the Bavaria Studios in Munich and on location at the Swiss resort town St. Moritz. The film's sets were designed by Ernst H. Albrecht. ==Cast== * Adrian Hoven as Hans Brugger * Hannelore Bollmann as Annelies Seethaler * Lucie Englisch as Ludmilla Möller * Charlotte Kerr as Peggy Swenson * Walter Riml as Hein Möller * Peter W. Staub as Fietje Schwedler * Franz Muxeneder as Toni * Alfred Pongratz as Holzbichler * Beppo Brem as Wastl * Bum Krüger as Dr. Schlauch * Ernst Schönle as Grauhuber ==References == == Bibliography == * Hans-Michael Bock and Tim Bergfelder. The Concise Cinegraph: An Encyclopedia of German Cinema. Berghahn Books, 2009. == External links == * Category:1952 films Category:1952 comedy films Category:German comedy films Category:West German films Category:German- language films Category:Films directed by Hans Albin Category:Films directed by Harry R. title: Carnival in White
